title: Missing Clang requirement during linking
body:
On clean/fresh install of `Ubuntu 22.04`, while setting up the `lfortran` project using the steps at https://docs.lfortran.org/en/installation/#build-from-git, it builds. But when we try to compile some source code, we face`sh: 1: clang: not found` error. 

## Steps to reproduce:

1. `sudo apt-get install binutils-dev zlib1g-dev`
2. `conda create -n lf -c conda-forge llvmdev=11.0.1 bison=3.4 re2c python cmake make toml`
3. `conda activate lf`
4. `./build0.sh`
5. `./build1.sh`
6. `./src/bin/lfortran examples/expr2.f90`

**Output:**
```bash
(lf) ubaid@ubaid-Lenovo-ideapad-330-15ARR:~/Desktop/Open-Source/lfortran$ ./src/bin/lfortran examples/expr2.f90
sh: 1: clang: not found
The command 'clang -o a.out a.out.tmp.o  -L"/home/ubaid/Desktop/Open-Source/lfortran/src/bin/../runtime" -Wl,-rpath,"/home/ubaid/Desktop/Open-Source/lfortran/src/bin/../runtime" -llfortran_runtime -lm' failed.
(lf) ubaid@ubaid-Lenovo-ideapad-330-15ARR:~/Desktop/Open-Source/lfortran$ 
```
